critical_issues: Customer explicitly denied gynecological problems ('No') while MER states 'Yes' with PCOD details. This is a significant factual discrepancy.
Incomplete declaration read by the agent.
Agent did not ask about all parts of the 'Brain disorder' question (mental/psychiatric illness, HIV/HCV/HbsAg).

Agent did not ask about all parts of the 'Diabetes, High Blood pressure, Heart attack or any other heart related disorder or cancer' question for the LA herself (Heart attack, other heart related disorder, cancer).
Missing confirmation of Application Number, Date, and Contact Number.
recommendations: Agent must confirm customer and nominee details accurately at the start of the call.
Agent must ensure all parts of multi-part health questions are explicitly asked to gather complete information.
Agent must re-verify information when there is a discrepancy or potential contradiction (e.g., PCOD mentioned earlier, but denied when asked about gynecological problems).
Agent must read the full legal declaration as per the MER document and obtain explicit agreement from the customer.
Agent should confirm application number, date, and contact number with the customer.

customer_satisfaction_indicators: Customer thanks the doctor at the end.
